name: Critical Art Ensemble
biography:
Critical Art Ensemble (CAE) is a collective of tactical media practitioners of various specialisations, including computer graphics and web design, film and video, photography, text art, book art and performance.  Formed in 1987, CAE's focus has been on the exploration of the intersections between art, critical theory, technology and political activism.  The collective has performed and produced a wide variety of projects for an international audience at diverse venues, ranging from the street to the museum to the internet.  CAE have also written five books: The Electronic Disturbance (1994) and its companion text Electronic Civil Disobediance and Other Unpopular Ideas (1996); Flesh Machine: Cyborgs, Designer Babies (1998), New Eugenic Consciousness (1998) and its companion text The Molecular Invasion (2002) and Digital Renaissance: Explorations in Tactical Media (2001).

Taken from the PROOF Exhibition 2004.
